climbs.name: White Dog
climbs.fa: Reggie Slavens, Bob Robertson, Stacy Suter

content.description: Follow the line of bolts on the panel to the right of the angling crack to the ledge. Follow the vertical crack from the middle of the ledge. When the crack runs out, angle slightly right and then back left to the ring anchors. The bolts above the ledge (around the crux) are closely spaced to prevent decking on the ledge.
content.location: This is the furthest route to the right.

climbs.name: Three Old Dogs
climbs.fa: Bob Robertson, Reggie Slavens, Roland Merril, January 23, 2016

content.description: In the back of Toasty Corner is a large "slot".  This route goes up the crack and left side of the slot.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor (welded cold shuts).
content.location: This is in the Toasty Corner area.

content.description:
Climb the steep to overhanging face between

Slot Machine

&

Killer Chihuahua

.
content.protection:
7 bolts & anchor.

Per

Sarah Meiser

: all of the hangers were removed 11/18.
content.location: This route is in the upper section of Toasty Corner.

climbs.name: Sparky
climbs.fa: Bob Robertson, Reggie Slavens, Roland Merril, January 23, 2016

content.description: Follow the bolts up past the right side of a large flake. It is short but fun.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor (welded cold shuts).
content.location: At the far right end of the 2150 Wall is a pillar.  Around the corner to the right of the pillar is the Toasty Corner Area.  This route is on the arête on the left end of the Toasty Corner area.

content.description: Slot Machine goes up the "arete" on the right hand side of the large slot in the corner. The anchor may appear to be placed too high; however, there are holds on the bulge and in the corner that allow you to get high enough to clip in with the usual single length sling girth hitched from your harness.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a 2 bolt welded cold shuts anchor. Using a stick clip for the 1st bolt is recommended. Otherwise you can scramble up inside the large slot in the corner, and reach/stretch around right to place a "courtesy clip". Then drop down and start the route from the ground.
content.location: The route it located in the Toasty Corner to the right of the 2150 Wall.

climbs.name: Killer Chihuahua
climbs.fa: Bob Robertson, Reggie Slavens, Steve Andrilla, January 29, 2016

content.description: Follow the line of bolts up the "open book" on the right face of "Toasty Corner".  The ominous looking block up high is actually quite solid.  The block could not be bulged despite using a large crow bar and standing on it.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a 2 bolt, welded, cold shuts anchor.
content.location: This is in the middle of the right face of "Toasty Corner". Toasty Corner is right of the 2150 Wall. Follow the trail markers for 2150 Wall. At the 2150 Wall/Gem Wall marker, take the Gem Wall trail. It's easiest to approach the climbs in Toasty Corner from the far right side just right of a large tree.

climbs.name: Kicker
climbs.fa: Bob Robertson and Reggie Slavens, January 13, 2016

content.description: This route catches the sun early.  Start in a shallow, right-facing corner - use large holds in the corner and on the pillar. Continue up the face above the pillar. Layback the crack above the face to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2-bolt, 1/2", welded cold shuts anchor.
content.location: It is on the south face of the tower at the far right end of the 2150 Wall. Follow the 2150 Wall trail to the fork for the Gem Wall. Take the Gem Wall fork. The route starts where the trail comes to the base of the wall/tower.

climbs.name: Burnt Toast
climbs.fa: Reggie Slavens, Bob Robertson, Tim Stich,12/30/16

content.description:
Waiting for the Bank proper to come into the sun? Start your day off with this fun warm up that catches the early rays.

The first bolt was centrally placed so that you can start on either the left or right side of the bulge. The right side start seems to be easier and more secure.  Then work upwards towards a crack on the left end of a small roof at approximately mid-height. Continue up easier ground to the anchor.

Note: it's hard to spot the anchor (welded coldshuts) from the ground.
content.location: At the far right end of the 2150 Wall is a pillar/buttress. Around the corner to the right/east of the pillar/buttress is the Toasty Corner Area. This route is the leftmost route on the arête that terminates the left end of the Toasty Corner area.
